RS 20125 Hack:Bruce,Yes, I just finished hacking =
one, too. It definitely is harder. The biggest thing I can recommend is to =
not remove the bottom board. If you can tear only the front section of the =
radio and keep the bottom intact, you will fare better. Simply undo the top=
 little board that has the LCD window (4 clips), flip it back, and punch ou=
t the 7th wire from the right. A Bruce mentioned, you will need to be caref=
ul with the two little buttons up top for the light and SW button (that you=
 don't need). You may be able to hold them in place with a toothpick for ea=
ch one when you pop the board up. If you lose them in the radio, don't worr=
y about it. Let it go and re-assemble. The radio will work just fine for yo=
u.As Steve mentioned earlier, the shortwave sweeps slow, unless you hold it=
 in. The AM and FM sweep like the RS12-470 (older version). Clean sweep - n=
ice unit. If I get some time, I took some pictures of what it looks like op=
ened up. I can post them on here for you to see. Are we gonna' call this "S=
teve's Box," or the RS Hack 20125? LOL! ;)LChttp://www.AngelsGhosts.com--- =

>> Hey guy's > > I just got done hacking the new box Steve H. has found.> I=
t works fine on all bands. It is a little tougher to modify than a > 469 or=
 470 in the fact that it is harder to disassemble but with a > little patie=
nce you will have a nice little box.> > It sweeps smoothly and has a telesc=
opic antenna attached, runs on 3 AA> batteries or an AC adapter, the adapte=
r is not supplied with the > radio but can be purchased at radio shack.> > =
I have not done a session with it as I only finished the hack about 5 > min=
utes ago, but everything is working fine and it is sweeping nicely.> > some=
thing to beware of, when you remove the second board you release > two smal=
l plastic buttons that are for changing the sw band and the > lcd light the=
y can fall out of the radio and are not so easy to > replace so be careful =
of that.> > Both back and front covers remove, the front cover will come lo=
ose > after removing the second board and you will see the speaker. You > m=
ust carefully turn the second board over and you will see a grey > ribbon w=
ire, the individual wires are attached by an 1/8 inch of > plastic on eithe=
r side of each wire. The wire that you must clip is > the mute wire, It is =
the 7th wire from the top.> > Cut the plastic attaching the wires together =
with an exacto knife or > razor blade, just enough to get a small pair of s=
cissors in to snip > the correct wire. I like to not only snip the wire but=
 snip out about > an 1/8 of an inch segment of the wire so that the cut end=
s do not > accidentally touch to make a connection when the box is reassemb=
led.> > The modification is by no means hard it is just have to be a bit mo=
re > attentive than when you modify a 469 or 470.> > Anyone that feels they=
 will have a problem you can skype me under> Bruce Halliday and I will be g=
lad to talk you through it.> > Bruce>
